context: After the first race — Diesel observes the player from the shadows

lines.text: You're heading back to your car when something makes you stop. Not a sound. Not a movement. Just a feeling — like the air pressure changed.
Across the lot, past the last row of parked cars, there's a figure. Leaning against a matte black coupe that doesn't reflect the streetlights. Arms crossed. Still as concrete.
You can't make out a face. Just a silhouette. Broad shoulders. A cigarette ember, barely visible — a faint orange dot that doesn't move.
He's watching you. Not the crowd. Not the cars. You.
The hair on the back of your neck stands up. It's not fear exactly — it's the feeling of being measured. Weighed. Like someone is deciding if you're worth their time.
You blink — and the cigarette ember is gone. The coupe is already pulling away, silent as a ghost. No rev, no show. Just headlights cutting through the dark and then nothing.
You stand there for a long moment. Whoever that was, they wanted you to know they were there. And that feels more dangerous than any race.
